tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: 木の葉丼（このはどん・このはどんぶり）とは、大阪および京都界隈で一般に供される丼物である。
sen.e: Konoha-don (also pronounced "Konoha-donburi") is a kind of donburimono (rice dish) which is commonly served in Osaka and Kyoto area.
Konoha-don, also referred to as Konoha-donburi, is a kind of donburimono (rice dish) which is commonly served in Osaka and Kyoto area.
sen.cmt: カッコ部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Konoha-don, also referred to as Konoha-donburi, is a kind of donburimono (rice dish) which is commonly served in Osaka and Kyoto area.

sen.j: 見た目は親子丼に似ているが、鶏肉の代わりに薄く切った蒲鉾を鶏卵で綴じる。
sen.e: It looks like Oyako-don (literally meaning donburimono of parent and child, it is a bowl of rice with chicken and egg), but thinly sliced kamaboko (boiled fish paste) is used instead of chicken to cook with lightly beaten hen's egg.

It looks like Oyako-don (bowl of rice with chicken and egg, literally, parent and child rice bowl), but thinly sliced kamaboko (boiled fish paste) is used instead of chicken to cook with lightly beaten chicken eggs.
sen.cmt: カッコ部分を修正しました。hen's egg→chicken eggs と修正しました。
sen.e: It looks like Oyako-don (bowl of rice with chicken and egg, literally, parent and child rice bowl), but thinly sliced kamaboko (boiled fish paste) is used instead of chicken to cook with lightly beaten chicken eggs.

sen.j: また好みによってシイタケやネギなどを入れる。
sen.e: Depending what one likes, it can also contain shiitake mushroom, green onion and so on.
Depending on what one likes, shiitake mushrooms, green onions and so on can be added.
sen.cmt: on を挿入し、also contain→be added,mushroom→mushrooms,onion→onions と修正しました。 it を削除し、オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: Depending on what one likes, shiitake mushrooms, green onions and so on can be added.

sen.j: 安価な食材で簡単に作れるので、庶民的な家庭料理として親しまれ、大衆食堂などでも定番のメニューとなっている。
sen.e: As it can be made of inexpensive foodstuffs, it is popular as a common home cooking and is also on the menu of inexpensive eating places as a standard dish.
As it can be made of inexpensive ingredients, it is popular as a common home cooking and is also on the menu of inexpensive restaurants as a standard dish.
sen.cmt: foodstuff→ingredients,eating places→restaurants と修正しました。
sen.e: As it can be made of inexpensive ingredients, it is popular as a common home cooking and is also on the menu of inexpensive restaurants as a standard dish.

sen.j: 名前の由来は、蒲鉾を舞い散る木の葉に見立てたものといわれるが、発祥は定かではない。
sen.e: It is said that the name came from the comparison of kamaboko to tree leaves fluttering down, but how it originated is unclear.
It is said that the name came from the comparison of the kamaboko to the tree leaves fluttering down, but the origin is unclear.
sen.cmt: the を挿入しました。how it originated→the origin と修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that the name came from the comparison of the kamaboko to the tree leaves fluttering down, but the origin is unclear.

sen.j: 石川県では、木の葉丼を「玉子丼」（たまごどん）と称して供する飲食店が見られる。
sen.e: In Ishikawa Prefecture, konoha-don is served by the name of 'Tamago-don' (donburimono with egg) at many eating places.
In Ishikawa Prefecture, konoha-don is served with the name of 'Tamago-don' (donburimono with egg) at some restaurants.
sen.cmt: by→with,many eating places→some restaurants と修正しました。
sen.e: In Ishikawa Prefecture, konoha-don is served with the name of 'Tamago-don' (donburimono with egg) at some restaurants.

sen.j: 関西では、親子丼に似た丼物で他に若竹丼（筍を卵で綴じている）、ハイカラ丼（揚げ玉を綴じる）、衣笠丼（油揚げを綴じる）などがある。
sen.e: In Kansai area, there are other donburimono which are similar to Oyako-don: Wakatake (young bamboo)-don (bamboo shoot is cooked with lightly beaten egg), Haikara (stylish)-don (bits of fried tempura batter is cooked with lightly beaten egg), Kinugasa (umbrella)-don (deep-fried tofu is cooked with lightly beaten egg) and so on.

In Kansai area, there are other donburimono which are similar to Oyako-don: Wakatake (young bamboo)-don (bamboo shoot is cooked with lightly beaten egg), Haikara (stylish)-don (bits of fried tempura batter is cooked with lightly beaten egg), Kinugasa (umbrella)-don (deep-fried tofu is cooked with lightly beaten egg) and so on.

In Kansai area, there are other donburimono which are similar to Oyako-don: Wakatake (young bamboo)-don (bamboo shoot is cooked with lightly beaten egg), Haikara (stylish)-don (bits of fried tempura batter is cooked with lightly beaten egg), Kinugasa (umbrella)-don (deep-fried tofu is cooked with lightly beaten egg) and so on.

sen.j: 衣笠丼に至っては、京都では定番であるが、それ以外の地域・たとえば神戸・大阪などの近畿では、キツネ丼として供されている場合がある。
sen.e: Although Kinugasa-don is a standard item in Kyoto, in other cities, for example Kinki region including Kobe, Osaka and so on; it is sometimes served by the name of Kitsune-don.
Although Kinugasa-don is a standard dish in Kyoto, in other cities, for example Kinki region including Kobe, Osaka and so on, it is sometimes served as Kitsune-don.
sen.cmt: item→dish,;→,,by the name of→ass と修正しました。
sen.e: Although Kinugasa-don is a standard dish in Kyoto, in other cities, for example Kinki region including Kobe, Osaka and so on, it is sometimes served as Kitsune-don.

sen.j: また、木の葉丼の中に少し薄揚げが入っている店もある。
sen.e: At some restaurants a little usuage (thin deep-fried tofu) is added to Konoha-don.
At some restaurants, some usuage (thin deep-fried tofu) is added to Konoha-don.
sen.cmt: カンマを挿入しました。a little→some,
sen.e: At some restaurants, some usuage (thin deep-fried tofu) is added to Konoha-don.

sen.j: 他の地域では、名前自体見られる事は少ない。
sen.e: In other areas, even only the name of Konoha-don is seldom seen.
In other areas, even just the name is rarely found.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: In other areas, even just the name is rarely found.
